channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11731] Add option to only run a subset of the shell tests
item.description:
Right now, contributors to the shell can limit testing to just the shell tests but there's no way to limit to just a subset of them.

It would be nice if I could just run the test for the thing I'm changing.
item.summary: Add option to only run a subset of the shell tests

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Perhaps something like a regex to match the shell test files?:

run just the admin tests:

mvn -Dtest=TestShell -Dshell.test=hbase/admin_test.rb

run both normal admin and security admin tests:

mvn -Dtest=TestShell -Dshell.test=hbase/*admin_test.rb

run just the tests for the shell itself:

mvn -Dtest=TestShell -Dshell.test=shell/*_test.rb

Alternatively, since we currently rely on test files being named like "*/_test.rb", we could document that and then make the test list a comma separated list.

run just the admin tests:

mvn -Dtest=TestShell -Dshell.test=admin

run both normal admin and security admin tests:

mvn -Dtest=TestShell -Dshell.test=*admin

run just the tests for the shell itself:

mvn -Dtest=TestShell -Dshell.test=commands,formatter,noninteractive,shell

That last one is uglier if I don't want to know the list ahead of time, since I need to do a list and then a sed.

A disadvantage of this approach is that it presumes there won't be a file name conflict in the test subdirectories.

Edit: Fix paste-o (hopefully)
well that was an unfortunate pasting error.

I attempted to fix that.

I think regex by test name would be the better option, only because JUnit test selection is regex by class name and/or package, not directories and files.

Edit looks correct for fixing the paste error. Thanks!

When you say "test name" do you mean the start of the file name containing tests (like the second example above)?

Or do you mean the name of the classes we declare our tests in?

e.g. "AdminHelpersTest" in the example below


module Hbase

  class AdminHelpersTest < Test::Unit::TestCase

    include TestHelpers

The latter option will be substantially harder to implement. I think I can do it with some ugly ruby, but I would no longer consider the ticket "beginner".

Worth noting that we can't practically do this filtering at the level of individual tests, because they have names like "exists? should return true when a table exists".

When you say "test name" do you mean the start of the file name containing tests (like the second example above)? Or do you mean the name of the classes we declare our tests in?

The name of the classes we declare our tests in. But if this is going to be difficult, then I'd say globbing test file names will be good enough.

Here's an implementation that allows matching the RUnit test cases (which should correspond to the names of test classes.

It turns out RUnit had a (somewhat non-obvious) way to do this already, so I just hooked into that. One downside is that we have to use ruby-style regex literals to do the wildcard matching.

Since this might be surprising, I added text to the book's dev section on testing.

I verified by trying out the commands given in the new docs.

Unfortunately, the only way I can find to get the output of the actual ruby code is to insert a test that fails so that stdout/stderr will be placed in the XML surefire report. With that alteration in place, I can verify both the total test count when the shell.test param isn't given as well as the correct counts for specifying a test and a wildcard of tests.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12661681/HBASE-11731.patch

This message is automatically generated.
test result support shows no failures, so I'm not sure what QA is complaining about.

My Ruby-foo is weak. Given that caveat, the changes look straightforward. Great doc update. +1

Will commit shortly to 0.98+ unless objection. Ping Enis Soztutar for branch-1

Committed to 0.98+

I dropped the doc change in the branch backports since our current release practice is to copy back trunk docs over branch docs when spinning release candidates.

TestShell passes locally.
